metadata.title: CVE-2022-48926 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:usb: gadget: rndis: add spinlock for rndis response listThere's no lock for rndis response list. It could cause list corruptionif there're two different list_add at the same time like below.It's better to add in rndis_add_response / rndis_free_response/ rndis_get_next_response to prevent any race condition on response list.[  361.894299] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979] list_add corruption.next->prev should be prev (ffffff80651764d0),but was ffffff883dc36f80. (next=ffffff80651764d0).[  361.904380] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979] Call trace:[  361.904391] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]  __list_add_valid+0x74/0x90[  361.904401] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]  rndis_msg_parser+0x168/0x8c0[  361.904409] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]  rndis_command_complete+0x24/0x84[  361.904417] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]usb_gadget_giveback_request+0x20/0xe4[  361.904426] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]  dwc3_gadget_giveback+0x44/0x60[  361.904434] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]dwc3_ep0_complete_data+0x1e8/0x3a0[  361.904442] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]  dwc3_ep0_interrupt+0x29c/0x3dc[  361.904450] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]dwc3_process_event_entry+0x78/0x6cc[  361.904457] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]  dwc3_process_event_buf+0xa0/0x1ec[  361.904465] [1:   irq/191-dwc3:16979]  dwc3_thread_interrupt+0x34/0x5c

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48926` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-azure - 4.15.0-1138.151~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~14.04.1').
